questions.question: Which word is an adjective in the following sentence? "The curious child asked many questions."
questions.explanation: "Curious" is an adjective that describes the noun "child."

questions.question: Which word is an adjective in the following sentence? "The tiny mouse scurried across the floor."
questions.explanation: "Tiny" is an adjective that describes the noun "mouse."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adverb: The little girl sang _____ in the school play.
questions.explanation: "Beautifully" is an adverb that describes how the girl sang (the verb).

questions.question: Which word is an adverb in the following sentence? "The friendly dog wagged its tail happily."
questions.explanation: "Happily" is an adverb that describes how the dog wagged its tail (the verb), while "friendly" is an adjective that describes the noun "dog."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adjective: The _____ baby laughed at the silly faces.
questions.explanation: "Adorable" is an adjective that describes the noun "baby."

questions.question: Which word is an adjective in the following sentence? "The bright sun shone in the clear sky."
questions.explanation: Both "bright" and "clear" are adjectives in this sentence. "Bright" describes the noun "sun," while "clear" describes the noun "sky."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adverb: The polite boy spoke _____ to his teacher.
questions.explanation: "Respectfully" is an adverb that describes how the boy spoke (the verb).

questions.question: Which word is an adverb in the following sentence? "The clever fox quickly found the hidden food."
questions.explanation: "Quickly" is an adverb that describes how the fox found the food (the verb), while "clever" is an adjective that describes the noun "fox."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adjective: The _____ rainbow appeared after the rainy day.

questions.question: Which word is an adjective in the following sentence? "The tall giraffe reached for the leafy branches."
questions.explanation: Both "tall" and "leafy" are adjectives in this sentence. "Tall" describes the noun "giraffe," while "leafy" describes the noun "branches."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adverb: The excited puppy ran _____ to greet its owner.
questions.explanation: "Eagerly" is an adverb that describes how the puppy ran (the verb).

questions.question: Which word is an adverb in the following sentence? "The kind nurse gently bandaged the patient's wound."
questions.explanation: "Gently" is an adverb that describes how the nurse bandaged the wound (the verb), while "kind" is an adjective that describes the noun "nurse."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adjective: The _____ kitten played with the ball of yarn.
questions.explanation: "Playful" is an adjective that describes the noun "kitten."

questions.question: Which word is an adjective in the following sentence? "The shiny red car raced down the long road."
questions.explanation: "Shiny," "red," and "long" are all adjectives in this sentence. "Shiny" and "red" describe the noun "car," while "long" describes the noun "road."

questions.question: Fill in the blank with an adverb: The athlete _____ leapt over the hurdle.
questions.explanation: "Effortlessly" is an adverb that describes how the athlete leapt (the verb).
